title: What is the YouTube benefit of deleting K-pop MV views? - Quora

response.answer_text: People who use bots or obsessively stream are basically rigging the system of Youtube views. There's been an inflation almost because when you see a music video with 100M views it's misleading because it wasn't 100M unique watchers and in fact probably nowhere near that number. If the video gets a lot of views, it will be promoted more, but music videos of groups from small companies who don't have a cult of avid streamers get harder and harder to find. Streamers are also helping the person or the company that uploaded the video cheat with ad revenue. Come on guys, you know that money's not going towards your idols…

I think they do it because over half of those views are probably from people streaming. It’s not exactly right to delete the views though, because people worked hard on getting them. I get where they come from though. *I’m not sure why some groups don’t have their views deleted though.
To be honest they are not benefited. Many k-popers stream the MV without any break which causes some technical issues with the views. So sometime they freez the views
The benefit is, in short, making the number of views displayed as legit as possible. No streaming.
